Interface TaskManage

extends java.io.Serializable

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        void addTask(java.util.UUID person,
             Task task)
        Add a task for the person.
        Parameters:
        person - the person.
        task - the new task for that person.
        Throws:
        ScheduleException - if the event can't be added.
        See Also:
        Schedule.add(IEvent)

      • hasTaskFor

        boolean hasTaskFor(java.util.UUID person,
                   Event event)
        Check does the person has a task for the event. (using Task.isTaskFor(event))
        Parameters:
        person - the person.
        event - the id of the event.
        Returns:
        true if there is a task for that event, otherwise false

      • removeTaskFor

        void removeTaskFor(java.util.UUID person,
                   Event event)
        Remove the task for the event of the person. (using Task.isTaskFor(event)) If no such task, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        person - the person.
        event - the id of the event.

      • getTasks

        java.util.List<Task> getTasks(java.util.UUID person)
        Return a list of task for that person.
        Parameters:
        person - the person.
        Returns:
        a list of task.

      • getConflicting

        java.util.List<Task> getConflicting(java.util.UUID person,
                                    Task task)
        Return a list of conflicting task to that task for the person.
        Parameters:
        person - the person.
        task - a task to check.
        Returns:
        a list of task.
        See Also:
        Schedule.getConflicting(IEvent)

      • createTask

        Task createTask(java.lang.String type,
                Event event)
        Create a Task based on type. This method should use the TaskFactory.
        Parameters:
        type - the type
        event - the event.
        Returns:
        a Task.
        See Also:
        TaskFactory
